meanings.definition: Find or discover by investigation or searching.
meanings.sent1: She traced the missing toy under the bed.
meanings.sent2: The detective traced the criminal's whereabouts.
meanings.sent3: The kids traced the treasure map to the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition traced the solution to the problem.
meanings.sent5: The scientist traced the source of the mysterious sound.

meanings.definition: Copy (a drawing, map, or design) by drawing over its lines on a superimposed piece of transparent paper.
meanings.sent1: He traced the cartoon character onto a blank sheet.
meanings.sent2: She traced the outline of the flower for her art project.
meanings.sent3: The teacher traced the alphabet letters for the students to color.
meanings.sent4: The child traced the picture to practice drawing.
meanings.sent5: The artist traced the skyline to create a new painting.

meanings.definition: Follow or mark the course or position of (something) with one's eye, mind, or finger.
meanings.sent1: He traced the path of the shooting star across the sky.
meanings.sent2: She traced the outline of the mountain range on the map.
meanings.sent3: The cat traced the movement of the laser pointer on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The hiker traced the trail up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The child traced the shape of the cloud with his finger.
